name: The Dream
paragraphs: Your parent and the others exchange a worried glance as you insist that everything that's happened was just a dream. "It's okay," your parent says gently. "We know it wasn't real, but we're just glad to have you back." You feel a wave of relief wash over you as you realize that you're safe and surrounded by people who care about you.

As you leave the hospital with your parent, you can't shake the feeling that something important has been lost. You may never know what really happened during your time there or what those creatures were truly capable of. But as you look up at the sky and take a deep breath of fresh air, you know that you're grateful to be alive and free.
